head.title: Ancient Art Show For Getty Opening

hedline.hl1: Ancient Art Show For Getty Opening

abstract.p: Getty Center, $1-billion arts complex in foothills of Santa Monica Mountains in Los Angeles, will open in December with exhibition of ancient artworks; six-building center designed by Richard Meier will feature new J Paul Getty Museum, along with institutes for conservation, research, education, information and grants; Getty Museum in Malibu is closing, and will reopen in 2001 with exhibits of ancient art (S)

block.p: The Getty Center, a $1 billion arts complex in the foothills of the Santa Monica Mountains in Los Angeles, is to open on Dec. 16 with an exhibition of ancient artworks. The six-building center, designed by Richard Meier, will feature a new J. Paul Getty Museum along with institutes for conservation, research, education, information and grants. Plans were conceived more than 13 years ago.

The Getty Center, a $1 billion arts complex in the foothills of the Santa Monica Mountains in Los Angeles, is to open on Dec. 16 with an exhibition of ancient artworks. The six-building center, designed by Richard Meier, will feature a new J. Paul Getty Museum along with institutes for conservation, research, education, information and grants. Plans were conceived more than 13 years ago.

In addition to galleries featuring the Getty's permanent art collection and visiting shows, public spaces at the center will include a reading area, a research library, an auditorium, a restaurant, two cafes and a bookstore. Admission will be free, but reserved parking, at $5 a car, will be required. The J. Paul Getty Museum at the Getty Villa in Malibu is to close for renovations on July 6 and is to reopen in 2001 as a center devoted to ancient art.
